intro: Ardisia zambalensis, commonly known as the Zambal ardisia, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy texture. Its small, white flowers are followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia zambalensis is often found in forest understories, thriving in shaded, moist environments.
